bug.author: BarclayII
bug.summary: Messages not ordered by edge IDs in degree bucketing
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
See the following code. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>In [1]: import dgl Using backend: pytorch INFO:rdflib:RDFLib Version: 4.2.2
In [3]: g = dgl.graph(([1, 3, 5, 0, 4, 2, 3, 3, 4, 5], [1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 2, 2, 0, 3, 3]))
In [5]: def reducer(nodes): ...: print(nodes.mailbox['eid']) ...: return {'n': nodes.mailbox['eid'].sum(1)} ...:
In [6]: import torch
In [7]: g.edata['eid'] = torch.arange(10)
In [8]: g.update_all(dgl.function.copy_e('eid', 'eid'), reducer) tensor([[5, 6], [8, 9]]) tensor([[3, 7, 2], [0, 1, 4]]) </denchmark-code>
In 0.4.3post2: <denchmark-code>In [1]: import dgl Using backend: pytorch
In [2]: g = dgl.graph(([1, 3, 5, 0, 4, 2, 3, 3, 4, 5], [1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 2, 2, 0, 3, 3]))
In [3]: def reducer(nodes): ...: print(nodes.mailbox['eid']) ...: return {'n': nodes.mailbox['eid'].sum(1)}
In [8]: g.edata['eid'] = torch.arange(10).float()
In [9]: g.update_all(dgl.function.copy_e('eid', 'eid'), reducer) tensor([[2., 3., 7.], [0., 1., 4.]]) tensor([[8., 9.], [5., 6.]]) </denchmark-code>
This inconsistency will break TreeLSTM. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Should be consistent as 0.4.3. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
